laboratory_examinations.findings: Aplasia of the patellar tendon was documented.
Hypoplastic patella in a more proximal position than normal; patellar tendon absent; quadriceps muscle severely hypoplastic.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Two years postoperatively, the patella was positioned in the physiologic position, but the quadriceps muscle remained atrophic.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Hypoplasia of the femoral condyles; absence of patellar tendon.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: No significant change over time noted.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Reconstructed patellar tendon and patella in physiologic position; quadriceps muscle remains atrophic.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Active extension lag of 60Â° in the involved knee.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Patellar tendon aplasia on the right knee; patella in a more proximal position.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: No change in condition noted after two years.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Patella normal size but positioned proximal; patellar tendon absent; quadriceps muscle severely hypotrophic.
